page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Farming is the principal industry of the area. Most farms are owner - occupied. Crops grown include cereals, potatoes and other root crops, cider apples, hay, silage, oil seed rape and soft fruit (pick your own). The majority of the area is arable. Beef cattle are bred, including a pedigree herd of Hereford cattle in Kingsland. There is one local dairy herd. Breeds of cattle in the area include Herefords, Charolais, Friesian and Simmental. Sheep, poultry and bees are also kept locally. Breeds of sheep include Suffolk/Clun, Welsh half-breeds and other cross breeds, Kerry and Jacob. Sheep dogs are bred locally and are sold by auction. Poultry includes geese and guinea fowl as well as chickens.
